main.name: Eric Leong
main.bio: Hello~ I'm Eric. I'm currently a Sophomore at UC Berkeley. I came into Berkeley intending to study Biology and pursue the pre-med route for medical school. However, out of interest, I decided to take a Computer Science class and I enjoyed the class so much that decided to study Computer Science instead. Despite aiming to work in the industry as a Software Engineer, I still partake in research in areas related to Biology though I contribute to projects primarily through developing computational applications.
main.life: Besides my interest in the intersection between Biology and Computer Science, I am fond of Full Stack Development as a result of prior classes and projects in Web Development. Currently, I'm trying to develop my skills in Full Stack by acting as a Web Committee Director of Berkeley's local IEEE chapter.
main.life2: Outside of class and working, I playing sports, such as swimming, having swam competitively in the past, and basketball.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
